name: Banking
intro: Industry providing financial services related to storing, lending, and managing money.

businessModel.title: Value Proposition
businessModel.content: Banks act as intermediaries within the economy, connecting depositors with borrowers and facilitating financial transactions. They provide security and liquidity for funds, while also enabling economic growth through credit creation.

businessModel.title: Customer Segments
businessModel.content: Banks serve a diverse customer base, ranging from individuals to multinational corporations, and including small businesses, large corporations, governments, and non-profit organizations.

businessModel.title: Revenue Streams
businessModel.content: Banks generate revenue primarily through the difference between interest earned on loans and interest paid on deposits (Net Interest Income). Other revenue sources include fees for services like account maintenance, transactions, wealth management, and investment banking activities.

businessModel.title: Cost Structure
businessModel.content: Major bank costs include interest expenses on deposits, operating expenses (salaries, rent, technology), regulatory compliance costs, and provisions for loan losses.

businessModel.title: Key Activities
businessModel.content: Core banking activities encompass deposit taking, lending (commercial, consumer, mortgage), payment processing, trade finance, foreign exchange services, and risk management.

businessModel.title: Key Resources
businessModel.content: Essential bank resources include their branch networks, ATMs, online and mobile banking platforms, trading infrastructure,  vault and security systems, and a skilled workforce.

businessModel.title: Key Partnerships
businessModel.content: Banks collaborate with other financial institutions, credit rating agencies, technology providers, and payment networks to expand their service offerings and geographical reach.

businessModel.title: Customer Relationships
businessModel.content: Banks aim to build lasting customer relationships by providing personalized financial advice, convenient banking channels (branches, online, mobile), and a comprehensive suite of products and services.

businessModel.title: Channels
businessModel.content: Banks interact with customers through various channels, including physical branches, ATMs, online banking platforms, mobile applications, telephone banking, and dedicated relationship managers.

industryInsights.title: Accounting Key Metrics
industryInsights.content: Key bank performance indicators include Net Interest Margin (NIM), Return on Assets (ROA), Return on Equity (ROE), Efficiency Ratio, Loan-to-Deposit Ratio, and Non-Performing Loan Ratio. These metrics assess profitability, efficiency, asset quality, and capital adequacy.

industryInsights.title: Industry History
industryInsights.content: Banking has ancient roots, with early forms of lending and money changing dating back millennia. Modern banking emerged in the 14th century in Italian city-states. The industry has undergone significant transformation driven by economic cycles, technological advancements, globalization, and regulatory reforms.

industryInsights.title: Industry Trends
industryInsights.content: The banking sector faces continuous evolution driven by factors like Fintech disruption, evolving customer expectations, and increasing regulatory scrutiny. Key trends include the growth of digital banking, open banking initiatives, the application of artificial intelligence and machine learning, exploration of blockchain technology, and a greater emphasis on sustainable finance practices.

industryInsights.title: Industry Future
industryInsights.content: The future of banking will be shaped by the ongoing digital revolution, changing consumer behaviors, and a dynamic regulatory environment. Banks that successfully navigate these challenges by embracing digital transformation, prioritizing customer-centricity, and adapting to evolving regulations will be well-positioned for future success.

products.name: MUFG Global Corporate Banking

products.name: Standard Bank Business Banking
